availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: David M. Claggett (Hopkinsville, Christian County, Kentucky, attorney and soldier - Mjr. 17th Ky. Inf.)

body.p: Hopkinsville, Christian County, Kentucky, attorney and soldier. Kentucky native. Son of James Claggett and Miriam Claggett. Farmer in Todd County, Kentucky, in 1850. Household owned three enslaved persons in Todd County in 1850. Attorney in Hopkinsville, Christian County, Kentucky, in 1860. Served in the 25th Kentucky Volunteer Infantry Regiment (U.S.A.) as a captain from January 1, 1862 to April 4, 1863. Served in the 17th Kentucky Volunteer Infantry Regiment (U.S.A.) as a major from August 8, 1862 to January 23, 1865.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Todd County, District 2, p. 245A.
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Todd County, District 2, p. 167.

"Maj. D. M. Claggett" (1835-1869)," Find A Grave, Memorial 28875677, accessed June 21, 2023, http://www.findagrave.com/memorial/28875677.
Report of the Adjutant General of the State of Kentucky, vol. 1, 1861-1866 (Frankfort: Kentucky Yeoman Office, 1866), p. 940.
Report of the Adjutant General of the State of Kentucky, vol. 2, 1861-1866 (Frankfort: Kentucky Yeoman Office, 1866), p. 914.
